parameters.definition: Time required to produce each product on each machine
Limit for each product on constraints
Quantity of products to keep in store

description: What maintaining, selling, storing, and manufacturing policy should the company pursue in order to maximize profit? The company has \param{M} machines, each with a specific downtime \param{Downtime}. There are \param{K} products, each with an associated profit \param{Profit} and a production time on each machine given by \param{Time}. Products must adhere to limits given by \param{Limit}. The price for storing products is \param{StorePrice}, and they must keep a quantity of \param{KeepQuantity} in the store. The company has \param{WorkHours} work hours available for all machines combined.
